titleStmt.title: An answer to His Maiesties speech, by the gentry of the county of Yorke, attending His Maiesties at the city of Yorke on Thursday the 12 of May, 1642.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Richard Lownes, at his shop next without Ludgate,

notesStmt.note: "Wee are most assured that your royall person shall be secured in the reall fidelity of your subjects of this county withour any extraordinary guard." -- Last lines of text.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
